frameDefinitions: An Agent causes a Patient to be wet with a Liquid.
A fire which burns and requires an emergency-type response.
These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme.
In this frame, an Agent places the Theme in the Medium for an extended period of time, with the intent that the Theme will be affected by and absorb some of the Medium. '
In this frame an Ingestor takes a Substance into his or her body.
An Agent temporarily places a Theme into a Substance, often with the intention to remove it later.
frameExamples: Lionel Hutz <t>coated</t> the wall with paint.
Ellen <t>soaked</t> the beans in the water for 30 seconds.
You should refrain from <t>taking</t> vodka up the nose.
She <t>dunked</t> her sandwich into some tomato soup.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is a volitional animate being who causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to become wet.
The <fen>Liquid</fen> is a fluid or gas that permeates or covers the <fen>Patient</fen>.  It most frequently occurs in a PP Complement headed by with.
The <fen>Patient</fen> takes up the <fen>Liquid</fen> through its pores or has the <fen>Liquid</fen> covering its surface.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces the state of wetness.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> wets the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> wets the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The total material currently involved in combustion, including both the parts of the Fuel currently undergoing chemical alteration and the partially ionized gas that results from this process.
The entity that is undergoing rapid chemical alteration leading to damage or destruction.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fire</fen> is burning.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Fire</fen> is burning.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the actor who instigates the filling.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the physical object or substance which changes location.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the area or container being filled. Goal is generally the NP Object in this frame.
An event which brings about the filling of the <fen>Goal</fen>.
When the filling occurs.
Where the filling takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person performing the soaking.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the entity that changes location.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the substance in which the <fen>Theme</fen> is submerged.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> soaks the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the submerging occurs.
The <fen>Delivery_device</fen> is the means by which the <fen>Substance</fen> is ingested.
The <fen>Ingestor</fen> ingests the <fen>Substance</fen>.
The <fen>Substance</fen> is the drug or other substance that is ingested by the <fen>Ingestor</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Ingestor</fen> ingests the <fen>Substance</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Ingestor</fen> ingests the <fen>Substance</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> places the <fen>Theme</fen> into a <fen>Substance</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> temporarily goes partially or completely into the Substance.
The <fen>Substance</fen> is the fluid into which the <fen>Theme</fen> is placed. This may be metonymically represented by the container of the fluid.
The location in time when the dunking occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Hannah</fex> drenched the cat with anti-flea ointment.
Rev. Lovejoy carefully brushed the rolls <fex>with butter</fex>.
Ellen soaked <fex>the beans</fex> in the water for 30 seconds .
Bobby soaked the potatoes <fex>in water</fex> overnight.
<fex>She</fex> dunked her sandwich into some tomato soup.
She dunked <fex>her sandwich</fex> into some tomato soup.
She dunked her sandwich <fex>into some tomato soup</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: about one hundred and twenty gallons
